data.enText: break
to break without dividing into separate parts; to break sth in this way
The ice cracked as I stepped onto it.
He has cracked a bone in his arm.
Her lips were dry and cracked.
to break open or into pieces; to break sth in this way

data.chText: 山崖上的一块石头在暴风雨中崩塌下来。
data.enText: A chunk of the cliff had cracked off in a storm.
His face cracked into a smile.
to crack a nut

data.chText: 她往锅里打了一个鸡蛋。
data.enText: She cracked an egg into the pan.
hit
to hit sth/sb with a short hard blow

data.chText: 我的头撞上了低矮的天花板。
data.enText: I cracked my head on the low ceiling.

data.chText: 他用尺子猛击我的头部。
data.enText: He cracked me on the head with a ruler.
make sound
to make a sharp sound; to make sth do this

data.chText: 一颗炮弹飞过山脊爆炸了。
data.enText: A shot cracked across the ridge.

data.chText: 他抽响鞭子，策马飞奔而去。
data.enText: He cracked his whip and galloped away.
of voice
if your voice cracks , it changes in depth, volume, etc. suddenly and in a way that you cannot control

data.chText: 他悲恸失声地告诉我们他儿子去世的消息。
data.enText: In a voice cracking with emotion, he told us of his son's death.
under pressure
to no longer be able to function normally because of pressure

data.chText: 工作情况很糟糕，人们因过度紧张越来越吃不消了。
data.enText: Things are terrible at work and people are cracking under the strain.

data.chText: 他们审讯他多日后他就垮掉了。
data.enText: They questioned him for days before he cracked.
The old institutions are cracking.
find solution

data.chText: 找到解决（难题等的）方法
data.enText: to find the solution to a problem, etc. ; to find the way to do sth difficult
to crack the enemy's code

data.chText: 干了一年后，我觉得我已知道怎样做好这项工作了。
data.enText: After a year in this job I think I've got it cracked !
stop sb/sth

data.chText: 阻止，打击，击败，战胜（罪犯或敌人）
data.enText: to find a way of stopping or defeating a criminal or an enemy

data.chText: 警方破获了一个重大的贩毒集团。
data.enText: Police have cracked a major drugs ring.
open bottle
to open a bottle, especially of wine, and drink it
a joke
to tell a joke
get cracking
to begin immediately and work quickly

data.chText: 要做的工作很多，咱们马上就干吧。
data.enText: There's a lot to be done, so let's get cracking.
not all, everything, etc. sb's cracked up to be
not as good as people say

data.chText: 他远不是人们所说的那种优秀作家。
data.enText: He's not nearly such a good writer as he's cracked up to be.
crack the whip
to use your authority or power to make sb work very hard, usually by treating them in a strict way
use a sledgehammer to crack a nut

data.chText: 抡着大锤砸核桃；杀鸡用牛刀
data.enText: to use more force than is necessary
crack down (on sb/sth)

data.chText: 竭力取缔；严厉打击；镇压
data.enText: to try harder to prevent an illegal activity and deal more severely with those who are caught doing it

data.chText: 警方正在严厉打击毒品贩子。
data.enText: Police are cracking down on drug dealers.
crack on (with sth)

data.chText: （为尽快完成而）努力干；（急速）经过，穿过；快速继续下去
data.enText: to work hard at sth so that you finish it quickly; to pass or continue quickly

data.chText: 只要我们拼命干，今天应该就能刷完漆。
data.enText: If we crack on with the painting we should finish it today.

data.chText: 时间飞逝，可我们却远远没有完成。
data.enText: Time was cracking on and we were nowhere near finished.
crack up

data.chText: （因压力造成身体或精神）垮掉，崩溃
data.enText: to become ill, either physically or mentally, because of pressure

data.chText: 你再这样干下去，身体会垮掉的。
data.enText: You'll crack up if you carry on working like this.
to start laughing a lot

data.chText: 他一进来，人人都捧腹大笑起来。
data.enText: He walked in and everyone just cracked up.
crack sb up
to make sb laugh a lot

data.chText: 吉尔滑稽极了，逗得我哈哈大笑。
data.enText: Gill's so funny, she just cracks me up.
break
a line on the surface of sth where it has broken but not split into separate parts
This cup has a crack in it.
Cracks began to appear in the walls.

data.chText: 政府经济政策中的失误已开始显露出来。
data.enText: The cracks (= faults) in the government's economic policy are already beginning to show.
narrow opening
a narrow space or opening

data.chText: 她透过窗帘的缝隙窥视。
data.enText: She peeped through the crack in the curtains.
The door opened a crack (= a small amount) .
sound
a sudden loud noise
a crack of thunder
the sharp crack of a rifle shot
hit
a sharp blow that can be heard

data.chText: 她跌倒了，脑袋重重地磕了一下。
data.enText: She fell over and got a nasty crack on the head.
attempt
an occasion when you try to do sth

data.chText: 她希望今年再一次冲击世界纪录。
data.enText: She hopes to have another crack at the world record this year.
drug
crack cocaine
a powerful, illegal drug that is a form of cocaine

data.chText: 吸强效可卡因成瘾的人
data.enText: a crack addict
joke
a joke, especially a critical one

data.chText: 他开玩笑地损了一下她的长相，言语很是刻薄。
data.enText: He made a very unfair crack about her looks.
conversation
craic

data.chText: 好时光；友好愉快的交谈
data.enText: a good time; friendly, enjoyable talk
Where's the crack tonight?

data.chText: 他是个喜欢喝两杯又爱聊天的人。
data.enText: He's a person who enjoys a drink and a bit of crack.
at the crack of dawn
very early in the morning
a fair crack of the whip
a reasonable opportunity to show that you can do sth

data.chText: 我觉得我们没有得到合理的机会。
data.enText: I felt we weren't given a fair crack of the whip.

data.chText: 训练有素的；技艺高超的；优秀的；一流的
data.enText: expert and highly trained; excellent at sth
crack troops
He's a crack shot (= accurate and skilled at shooting) .

means: 找到解决（难题等的）方法
阻止，打击，击败，战胜（罪犯或敌人）

ex.chText: 如果你打碎那个茶杯，你得赔偿。
ex.enText: If you break the cup, you'll have to pay for it.

ex.chText: 他们正往上爬，梯子突然断了。
ex.enText: They were climbing when the ladder broke.
She broke the record in the long-jump competition.

synonyms.bx: 强调将某件东西扯、撕或击成碎片，可以针对具体的东西，也可以指抽象事物的整体或部分被破坏。

ex.enText: The little boy failed to crack the walnut.

ex.chText: 别往玻璃杯里倒热水，不然会烫裂杯子。
ex.enText: The glass will crack if you pour hot water into it.

ex.chText: 冰块的边缘开始裂开了。
ex.enText: The ice began to crack at the edge.

ex.chText: 今天早上她把一个盘子掉在地上打破了。
ex.enText: She dropped a plate and cracked it this morning.

ex.chText: 往碗里打3个蛋，并搅拌均匀。
ex.enText: Crack three eggs into a bowl and mix them together.

synonyms.bx: 通常指某物出现裂纹或裂成碎片，尤指为得到或使用某物内部的东西而将其砸开。

ex.chText: 树倒了，把我的车压坏了。
ex.enText: The tree fell and crushed my car.

ex.chText: 包裹在邮寄过程中受压而严重受损。
ex.enText: The package was badly crushed in the post.

synonyms.bx: 指较大的外力将某物压坏、压碎、压扁等。

ex.chText: 她的外套顺着接缝裂开了。
ex.enText: Her coat split along the seam.
How did you split your trousers?

synonyms.bx: 指（使）某物顺着直线方向裂开或撕裂。

data.enText: get cracking
to begin immediately and work quickly

data.chText: 要做的工作很多，咱们马上就干吧。
data.enText: There's a lot to be done, so let's get cracking.
not all, everything, etc. sb's cracked up to be
not as good as people say

data.chText: 他远不是人们所说的那种优秀作家。
data.enText: He's not nearly such a good writer as he's cracked up to be.
crack the whip
to use your authority or power to make sb work very hard, usually by treating them in a strict way
use a sledgehammer to crack a nut

data.chText: 抡着大锤砸核桃；杀鸡用牛刀
data.enText: to use more force than is necessary
at the crack of dawn
very early in the morning
a fair crack of the whip
a reasonable opportunity to show that you can do sth

data.chText: 我觉得我们没有得到合理的机会。
data.enText: I felt we weren't given a fair crack of the whip.
crack down (on sb/sth)

data.chText: 竭力取缔；严厉打击；镇压
data.enText: to try harder to prevent an illegal activity and deal more severely with those who are caught doing it

data.chText: 警方正在严厉打击毒品贩子。
data.enText: Police are cracking down on drug dealers.
crack on (with sth)

data.chText: （为尽快完成而）努力干；（急速）经过，穿过；快速继续下去
data.enText: to work hard at sth so that you finish it quickly; to pass or continue quickly

data.chText: 只要我们拼命干，今天应该就能刷完漆。
data.enText: If we crack on with the painting we should finish it today.

data.chText: 时间飞逝，可我们却远远没有完成。
data.enText: Time was cracking on and we were nowhere near finished.
crack up

data.chText: （因压力造成身体或精神）垮掉，崩溃
data.enText: to become ill, either physically or mentally, because of pressure

data.chText: 你再这样干下去，身体会垮掉的。
data.enText: You'll crack up if you carry on working like this.
to start laughing a lot

data.chText: 他一进来，人人都捧腹大笑起来。
data.enText: He walked in and everyone just cracked up.
crack sb up
to make sb laugh a lot

data.chText: 吉尔滑稽极了，逗得我哈哈大笑。
data.enText: Gill's so funny, she just cracks me up.

trans: （尤指更努力地）继续干；抓紧时间干

example: he took a crack at it

tr: a purified and potent form of cocaine that is smoked rather than snorted

example: he opened the window a crack

tr: a blemish resulting from a break without complete separation of the parts
example: there was a crack in the mirror
he heard the cracking of the ice
he can hear the snap of a twig

tr: a long narrow depression in a surface

example: he wanted a shot at the champion

tr: break into simpler molecules by means of heat
reduce (petroleum) to a simpler compound by cracking
break or crack on the surface only
example: The glass cracked when it was heated
heat and light cracked the back of the leather chair

tr: break suddenly and abruptly, as under tension
break partially but keep its integrity

example: Registrations cracked through the 30,000 mark in the county

tr: deal a hard blow, making a cracking noise
example: The teacher cracked him across the face with a ruler

tr: make a very sharp explosive sound
gain unauthorized access computers with malicious intentions

value.def: If something hard cracks, or if you crack it, it becomes slightly damaged, with lines appearing on its surface.

example.ex: A gas main had cracked under my neighbour's garage and gas had seeped into our homes...
example.tran: 邻居车库下面的煤气总管裂开了，煤气渗入了我们家。

example.ex: Remove the dish from the oven, crack the salt crust and you will find the skin just peels off the fish.
example.tran: 把盘子从烤箱里拿出来，弄碎鱼表面的那层盐，鱼皮就会从鱼身上剥落下来了。

value.def: If something cracks, or if you crack it, it makes a sharp sound like the sound of a piece of wood breaking.

example.ex: Thunder cracked in the sky...
example.tran: 空中雷声咔嚓作响。

example.ex: He cracked his fingers nervously.
example.tran: 他紧张不安地把手指按得咔吧作响。

value.def: If you crack a hard part of your body, such as your knee or your head, you hurt it by accidentally hitting it hard against something.

example.ex: He cracked his head on the pavement and was knocked cold.
example.tran: 他一头撞到人行道上，不省人事了。

value.def: When you crack something that has a shell, such as an egg or a nut, you break the shell in order to reach the inside part.

example.ex: Crack the eggs into a bowl.
example.tran: 把鸡蛋打在一个碗中。

value.def: If you crack a problem or a code, you solve it, especially after a lot of thought.

example.ex: He has finally cracked the system after years of painstaking research.
example.tran: 经过多年的努力研究，他终于找到了破解这个系统的办法。

value.tran: (尤指经过反复思考)找到…的解决办法，破译(密码)

value.def: If someone cracks, they lose control of their emotions or actions because they are under a lot of pressure.

example.ex: She's calm and strong, and she is just not going to crack...
example.tran: 她镇定而且坚强，绝不会垮掉。

example.ex: I had the conviction Larkin's nerve would crack and he'd squeeze the trigger in a reflex action...
example.tran: 我确信拉金会神经崩溃，他会反射性地扣动扳机。

example.ex: Some countries are showing signs of cracking under intense pressure from the United States.
example.tran: 有些国家在美国的强大压力下有崩盘的迹象。

value.def: If your voice cracks when you are speaking or singing, it changes in pitch because you are feeling a strong emotion.

example.ex: Her voice cracked and she began to cry.
example.tran: 她的声音变得沙哑，继而哭了起来。

value.tran: (因感情强烈而嗓音)变嘶哑，变沙哑

value.def: If you crack a joke, you tell it.

example.ex: He cracked jokes and talked about beer and girls.
example.tran: 他爱说笑话，喜欢谈论啤酒和姑娘。

value.def: If you say that something is not all it's cracked up to be, you mean that it is not as good as other people have said it is.

example.ex: Package holidays are not always all they're cracked up to be.
example.tran: 全包旅游并不总像人们说的那么好。

mean.def: If you crack on with something, you continue doing it, especially with more effort than before, or as quickly as possible.

example.ex: You've just got to crack on, whatever the problems are.
example.tran: 不管有什么问题，你都得抓紧时间努力干。

example.ex: Just tell him what to do and he'll crack on with the work.
example.tran: 告诉他该干什么就行了，他会抓紧时间尽快干完的。

mean.tran: (尤指更努力地)继续干；抓紧时间干

value.def: A crack is a very narrow gap between two things, or between two parts of a thing.

example.ex: Kathryn had seen him through a crack in the curtains.
example.tran: 凯瑟琳透过窗帘缝看见了他。

value.def: If you open something such as a door, window, or curtain a crack, you open it only a small amount.

example.ex: He went to the door, opened it a crack, and listened.
example.tran: 他朝门走去，打开一条门缝听着。

value.def: A crack is a line that appears on the surface of something when it is slightly damaged.

example.ex: The plate had a crack in it...
example.tran: 盘子上有一道裂纹。

example.ex: Hundreds of office buildings and homes developed large cracks in walls and ceilings.
example.tran: 数百栋写字楼和住宅楼的墙壁和天花板上都出现了裂缝。

value.def: A crack is a sharp sound, like the sound of a piece of wood breaking.

example.ex: Suddenly there was a loud crack and glass flew into the car...
example.tran: 突然发出一声巨大的爆裂声，玻璃碎片飞进了车里。

example.ex: 'Crack!' — The first shot rang out, hitting Paolo.
example.tran: “砰！”第一声枪响了，打中了保罗。

value.def: If you have or take a crack at something, you make an attempt to do or achieve something.

example.ex: I should love to have a crack at the Olympia title in my last year...
example.tran: 我非常愿意在我职业生涯的最后一年向奥林匹亚大赛冠军头衔发起冲击。

example.ex: She decided to head for the dormitory to take another crack at locating Blanche.
example.tran: 她决定回宿舍再找找布兰奇。

value.def: A crack is a slightly rude or cruel joke.

example.ex: When Paul made the crack about the 'famous girl detective', I began to suspect that he had it in for you.
example.tran: 当保罗挖苦你是“著名的女侦探”时，我开始怀疑他是不是故意刁难你。

value.tran: (略显粗鲁或刻薄的)笑话，俏皮话

value.def: Crack is a very pure form of the drug cocaine.
value.tran: 强效可卡因;强力古柯碱

value.def: A crack soldier or sportsman is highly trained and very skilful.

example.ex: ...a crack undercover police officer...
example.tran: 训练有素的便衣警察

example.ex: He is said to be a crack shot, despite weak vision in one eye.
example.tran: 尽管一只眼视力较弱，他仍被称为神枪手。

value.tran: (士兵或运动员)训练有素的，一流的

value.def: If you say that someone does something at the crack of dawn, you are emphasizing that they do it very early in the morning.

example.ex: I often start work at the crack of dawn when there is a big order to get out.
example.tran: 有大笔订单要处理时，我经常会清晨便开始工作。

value.def: If you paper over the cracks, you try to hide all the things that are wrong with something.

example.ex: The meeting was stormy, and the two sides managed only to paper over the cracks on some issues.
example.tran: 会议很激烈，但双方只是在试图掩盖某些问题上的错误。

value.def: If you get a fair crack of the whip, you are allowed a reasonable opportunity to succeed at something.

example.ex: None of them is expecting any favours, just a fair crack of the whip.
example.tran: 他们谁也不期望受到任何特殊照顾，只希望机会均等。

value.tran: 合理的机会;均等的机会

trans: 裂纹尖端；裂尖；产生裂纹的裂纹尖端；裂缝尖端
（尤指更努力地）继续干；抓紧时间干
抗裂性；抗裂度；裂纹阻力；抗龟裂性；抗开裂性
裂纹萌生；裂纹初始；初始裂纹寿命；裂纹起裂；起裂
横向裂纹；横裂纹；横向裂缝
